description: From Middle English nasturcium, from Old English nasturcium (“watercress”), from Latin nasturtium.

entries.meaning: The popular name of any of the plants in the Tropaeolum genus of flowering plants native to south and central America.
examples: Drenched were the cold fuchsias, round pearls of dew lay on the flat nasturtium leaves.

entries.meaning: A plant in this genus, Tropaeolum majus.
Any of the plants in the genus, Nasturtium, that includes watercress.
